description: Victim suffered non life threatening injuries
maintext: A Collingwood man is facing impaired driving charges after a OPP say a pedestrian was struck in the Blue mountains. Police were called to highway 26 and Timmons street around 10:30 Thursday night to reports of a pedestrian being hit and the suspect vehicle taking off. The victim was taken to hospital with non-life threatening injuries. Police eventually located the driver. A 28 year old man was arrested and is facing a list of charges.
title: Man Faces impaired charges after pedestrian struck
